Description: Originally four spacer-beads, now broken into several fragments and 31 beads in different materials and shapes. A: One spacer-bead made of red faience, broken into two parts. Relatively flat and short, high quality, with five segments completely preserved. Three spacer-beads, made of light green faience, one made of five segments, broken into 2 parts, one made of six segments, broken into 3 parts, one made of 5 segments, broken into five parts. All very short and flat. B: One cylindrical segmented bead made of white faience, only two segments preserved. C: One flattened spherical bead, with an edge running around the outer surface, made of red faience. D: One broken bead, originally in a lentoid shape, made of blue faience. E: Three disc-shaped beads, two made of white faience, one made of ostrich eggshell. F: 17 very small cylindrical beads, 16 made of yellow and one made of black faience, in a high quality. G: One larger flattened spherical bead made of glass, now in a yellowish pearlescent colour due to corrosion. H: Two complete and several fragments of roughly spherical beads, made of glass, now all corroded to a pearlescent colour.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
